title: Comscore, Former CEO Settle With SEC
text:
A logo sign outside an office building occupied by comScore in 2014.

Comscore Inc. and its former chief executive settled charges with the Securities and Exchange Commission that claim they inflated the analytics company’s revenue by about $50 million over a two-year period.

The SEC said Comscore overstated revenue through entering into nonmonetary deals and that Comscore and Serge Matta, its former CEO, “made false and misleading public disclosures.” The activity took place from February 2014 through February 2016.

Comscore will pay the SEC a $5 million settlement and Mr. Matta will pay the regulator $700,000, the SEC said. Mr. Matta will pay Comscore a $2.1 million clawback, the regulator and company said.

The analytics company said it “neither admits nor denies the Commission’s allegations.” Write to Allison Prang at allison.prang@wsj.com
